bestBHT.bht: The disciples were given the authority to preach and cast out demons, noting the distinction between the power of preaching and the power of exorcising. They were specifically granted divine authority to confirm their teachings through the power of driving out demons. The importance of this power is highlighted in Mark's emphasis on casting out demons. The disciples were ultimately appointed as apostles with the purpose of being able to heal various physical ailments and to expel demonic possessions.

Marvin Vincent: To have power [εχειν εξουσιαν] . Note that he does not say to preach and to cast out, but to preach and to have authority to cast out."
The power of preaching and the power of exorcising were so different that special mention is made of the divine authority with which they would need to be clothed."
The power of driving out demons was given that they might apply it in confirmation of their teaching.
Philip Schaff: Mark 3:15. The phrase, ‘to heal sicknesses’ is to be omitted. Mark gives special prominence to the power of casting out demons.
John Gill: And to have power to heal sicknesses... All manner of corporeal diseases that attend men and women.
and to cast out devils; from such who were possessed with them.
he chose and appointed them to be his apostles, with a view of conferring such powers upon them hereafter.

bhtAttempts.bht: The disciples were given the authority to preach and cast out demons, noting the distinction between the power of preaching and the power of exorcising. They were specifically granted divine authority to confirm their teachings through the power of driving out demons. The importance of this power is highlighted in Mark's emphasis on casting out demons. The disciples were ultimately appointed as apostles with the purpose of being able to heal various physical ailments and to expel demonic possessions.

The disciples were commissioned with the power to preach and have authority to cast out demons. This distinction underscores the significance of the divine authority they were to possess in confirming their teachings through the expulsion of evil spirits. The Gospel of Mark particularly emphasizes the disciples' ability to cast out demons, highlighting this aspect of their ministry. Ultimately, the disciples were appointed as apostles with the intention of exercising their power to heal physical afflictions and drive out demonic forces.

The disciples were commissioned with the power to have authority to cast out and preach. The importance of their divine authority in confirming teachings through the expulsion of evil spirits is highlighted. Mark's emphasis on casting out demons distinguishes their ministry. Ultimately, the disciples were appointed as apostles with the power to heal physical afflictions and drive out demonic forces.

The disciples were granted authority not only to preach, but also to have the power to cast out demons. This distinction underscores the significance of the divine authority they were bestowed with, serving as a confirmation of their teachings. The Gospel of Mark places special emphasis on the disciples' ability to drive out evil spirits, highlighting this specific aspect of their ministry. Ultimately, the purpose of their appointment as apostles was to enable them to heal physical illnesses and expel demonic possessions.

The disciples were given the authority to both preach and have the power to cast out demons. This distinction emphasizes the importance of their divine authority in confirming their teachings through the expulsion of evil spirits. Mark's emphasis on casting out demons stands out, underscoring this particular aspect of their ministry. Ultimately, the disciples were appointed as apostles with the purpose of healing physical ailments and driving out demonic forces.
